defitem.label: Processed by: Ashley Wellens, Student Volunteer and Kira A. Dietz, Archivist,

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The Arthur Sibold Collection includes VPI reunion materials. There is a VPI statistical data book, four postcards to Sibold, a 1914 class roster, a reunion news bulletin, and a letter directed to the alumni.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Arthur Sibold Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Arthur Sibold Collection, Ms1983-011, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Arthur Sibold collection was acquired by Special Collections prior to 1983.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Arthur Sibold Collection was completed in 1983. Additional description was completed in April 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Arthur Pleasant Sibold was from Pearisburg, Virginia. He attended V.P.I. between 1909 and 1914, where he rosed in the ranks becoming captain of Company D his senior year. Sibold studied Agriculture during his time at V.P.I. In addition, his senior year he was Vice-President of Planters club, treasurer of Y.M.C.A., on the Football team, Associate Editor of Tech, Associate Editor of Firing Line, Censor of Lee Literary Society, member of Tennis Club, and member of Cotillion Club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Arthur Sibold Collection includes VPI reunion materials from the Class of 1914, as well as several items of memorabilia and university history. There is a VPI statistical data book, four postcards to Arthur Sibold, a 1914 class roster, a reunion news bulletin, and a letter directed to the alumni.
